tossups.question: In a novel by an author with this surname, Ken debuts his avant-garde film as “The Morning Erection Festival”. In another novel by that author with this surname, a drunken visit to a batting cage turns sour when a tourist called Frank expresses a desire to kill babies. This is the surname of the author of novels titled 69 and (*) In the Miso Soup. Another author with this surname wrote a story about “Seeing the 100% Perfect Girl One Beautiful April Morning”, but may be better known for frequently writing about lost cats and cooking spaghetti. tossups.answer_sanitized: Murakami [accept Ryu Murakami or Haruki Murakami]

bonuses.leadin: For 10 points each, answer some questions about close packing:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: For 10 points each, answer some questions about close packing:
parts: Johannes Kepler conjectured that at most 74% or so of a space can be filled by these shapes, a result that was proved almost four hundred years later.

While hexagonal and cubic close packing are now known to be optimal, packing in this fashion has been empirically measured to have a density of around 65%. Objects packed in this way initially assume a loose configuration that gradually tightens as the container is shaken.

This formal proof of Kepler conjecture was organized by Thomas Hale and named by searching for a word with the first letters of "Formal", "Proof", and "Kepler" in that order; appropriately, its name     means a very small thing.

This formal proof of Kepler conjecture was organized by Thomas Hale and named by searching for a word with the first letters of "Formal", "Proof", and "Kepler" in that order; appropriately, its name     means a very small thing.

parts: Name this 2017 book, subtitled A Feminist Manifesto in Fifteen Suggestions. It is considered a follow-up to its author’s earlier essay, We Should All Be Feminists.
Dear Ijeawele (“ee-JAY-ah-WAY-lay”) is by this Igbo Nigerian author, who discussed “The Danger of a Single Story” in a notable TED talk.

Adichie (“ah-DEE-chay”) also wrote this novel, in which Kambili comes of age after leaving the household of her abusive father. This novel, Adichie’s debut, is named for the flowers that grow in Aunty Ifeoma’s (“ee-fe-YO-ma’s”) garden.

parts: This region of the solar system may be the result of the destruction of a planet called Phaeton (“FAY-tun”). This region between Mars and Jupiter contains the dwarf planet Ceres (“series”).

Earth’s moon is thought to have arisen from a collision with a planet called Theia (“THEE-uh”) that started out in one of these areas of the Earth-Sun system. Asteroids in these areas are called trojans.

Before general relativity, astronomers hypothesized this planet to explain precession in Mercury’s orbit. Hypothetical asteroids in a stable region between Mercury and the Sun are named after this fictional planet.

parts: Name this property with three varieties that allow the particles in a hadron to be distinguished.

Above the Hagedorn temperature, color confinement breaks down, allowing the polarization of the vacuum by these two specific types of particles. These two types of particle are found together in mesons and can mutually annihilate.

A quark can form a particle with its anti-quark because a color and its anti-color forms this color. Red, green, and blue were chosen as the color charges because they produce this color when combined.
